content.prompt: Complete the following code for overloading the constructors of the class Grade. Additionally, you need to implement the missing getters/setters for the three attributes of the class. For this task, you need to consider the following grade conversion table:Letter grade | Percent gradeA+: 97-100A: 93-96A-: 90-92B+: 87-89B: 83-86B-: 80-82C+: 77-79C: 73-76C-: 70-72D+: 67-69D: 63-66D-: 60-62F: Below 60Constructors definition:+ Grade(studentID: String) -> this one will set the percentGrade as 0 and letterGrade as F+ Grade(studentID: String, percent: int) + Grade(studentID: String, letter: char, sign: char) -> this one will set letterGrade as the concatenation of letter and sign, and the percent score as the upper limit of the corresponding range (e.g. if letter score is B+, percent will be equals to 89). If second parameter is ' ', do not concatenate (keep the single letter given as first parameter as it is).Important: you need to control that the Grade objects created (as well as getters/setters) accept grades only within the specified range (percentScore from 0 to 100,  letterGrade with first character from 'A' to 'F' and the second character has to be either '+', '-' or ' ' - the last one represents when the letter grade has no sign associated). In case the constructor is passed with a parameter outside the feasible range, you need to set the percentGrade as 0 and letterGrade as F.More instructions on how to implement the missing parts of this class are provided in the code below.

uses.used_by: Jordan Barria, Jordan Barria - University Of Pittsburgh
Jordan Barria, Jordan Barria - University Of Pittsburgh
